intro: Mostacillastrum gracile, commonly known as slender grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae, and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, narrow leaves. It produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that contain both male and female flowers. Mostacillastrum gracile is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
